poem:
Investigation

In the hollow corridors, 
power preys in darkness—
whispers of despair seep
through bars, haunt cells, 

sisterhood fractured 
beneath watchful eyes,
justice shrouded in silence.

In the dry stare
of morning light,
truth seeks its passage
through weary walls.
